response.summary:
Skilled software developer with experience in DevOps and Site-Reliability engineering. At eduNEXT, managed infrastructure in the cloud (AWS) for Open edX services, while successfully improving web platform availability and cost-performance ratio. Focused on fast problems resolution and providing high-quality tools to my team in order to deliver a reliable product to the customers on-time. Passionate about automation, research and cutting edge technology.

Technical proficiencies include:
- Cloud Computing: AWS (EC2, S3, VPC, RDS, IAM, Route 53, ACM, Cloudwatch, WAF, Cloudfront, EMR) using Linux OSs.
- Infrastructure as Code: Terraform, Terragrunt.
- Databases: MySQL, MongoDB, Redis, ElasticSearch, Memcached.
- Scripting languages: Python, Go, Bash.
- Automation/Devops: Ansible, CircleCI, Jenkins.
- Containers: Kubernetes, Docker.
- Tools/Methodologies: Git, JIRA, SCRUM.
- Web programming: Django, Gunicorn, NGINX.
- Monitoring: Prometheus, Grafama. NewRelic.

Among other personall skills include:
- Solution-oriented, Throubleshooting abilities
- Creativity
- Leadership
- Proactivity
- Team-work oriented
response.skills: Programming, Data Mining, Computer Vision, Java, Python, C, Ansible, Linux, Amazon Web Services (AWS), Terraform, docker, Docker Products, Kubernetes, MySQL, Django, Django REST Framework, DevOps, Site Reliability Engineering

profile_positions.description:
•  Migration of edx-services to self-manage Kubernetes infrastructure based on Tutor (in-progress).
•  Improved the scalability and efficiency of asynchronous tasks for edx-platform based on performance metrics obtained while running load tests.
•  Adoption of Terraform/Terragrunt to easily deploy and govern infrastructure to host SaaS service in Europe.
•  Tuning of databases and CDN to reduce response times and latency as well as tuning of WAF rules to reduce security vulnerabilities.
•  Quick support for issues escalated to the SRE team.
profile_positions.title: Site Reliability Engineer

profile_positions.description:
• Development and implementation of IoT web platform for data collection to automate irrigation in Citrus groves. The platform was based on Django (back-end), Grafana (front-end), and Kubernetes. It has a friendly GUI and can be configured by a non-programmer using Jenkins as a task trigger/automation tool. Different REST APIs were designed to receive data and allow networking between the different components of the platform.
•  Development of data-forwarder tool, that monitors locally stored data collected from several kinds of dataloggers and sends information to the cloud (IoT web platform) automatically.
•  Dataloggers programming for automating soil moisture sensors data collection.
•  Support on research activities like writing papers, presentations, fieldwork, and collaborations with other researchers.
profile_positions.title: Research Scholar

profile_positions.description:
• General development for operations tasks applied in different environments where \href{https://github.com/edx}{Open edX services} are used.
• Design and building of several application and databases server infrastructures, using Terraform as well as AWS and Azure consoles.
• Creation and management of local development environments using Vagrant and Docker as well as deployments in staging and production environments using Ansible.
• Development of Ansible and bash scripts used for the automation of several operation processes. Among them there are scripts to manage automatic deployments using Auto Scaling Groups in AWS, and a script to integrate the Amazon CloudWatch Agent to production environments.
• Advanced operation of task automation software like Jenkins (DSL Job Manager, Remote tasks building) and CircleCI, used in CD/CI processes (Automatic deployments, testing).
• Development and review of some simple custom features for edx services and site themes (Django, HTML templates). 
• Management of edx services private and public repositories (Smartgit, PRs, GitFlow).
profile_positions.title: DevOps Engineer

company.description:
eduNEXT is an online learning technology provider dedicated to services and solutions powered by the Open edX platform. We are driven by our customer's mission to deliver outstanding online learning experiences.
 
We are fully committed to the development and promotion of the Open edX technology, as well as making accessible to everyone state-of-the-art technologies, to provide high-quality education worldwide. 

Our team of Online learning specialists has been working exclusively in Open edX related projects since 2013, providing Software as a Service hosting solutions, consulting services, technology integration, infrastructure and other professional e-learning solutions for a wide range of online education, training and assessment initiatives around the world, 
empowering them to face the challenges of providing high quality online learning.

We have pioneered the provision of Open edX as a Service at a fraction of the cost that will imply to host and manage all the technology on-premise so that our clients can deploy fast, minimize the investment and concentrate on the production and management of high-quality online learning content, which is a big challenge in itself.

Our Open edX SaaS subscriptions qre the fastest way to get all the new features from the latest Open edX release! 

Get started immediately by launching one of our lite subscriptions that will get you the experience of running your site with us, and also a chance to use some of our features at no cost for a limited number of users. 

Contact us at sales@edunext.co or Visit our website www.edunext.co!
